message_1: Solve the inequality 3x - 9 > 21 and graph the solution on a number line.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 3x - 9 > 21, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 9 to both sides of the inequality.
3x - 9 + 9 > 21 + 9
3x > 30

Step 2: Divide both sides by 3.
3x/3 > 30/3
x > 10

The solution to the inequality is x > 10.

To graph the solution on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with 10 as a reference point.
2. Place an open circle at 10, since the inequality is "greater than" and not "greater than or equal to."
3. Shade the region to the right of the open circle, indicating that all values greater than 10 are part of the solution.

The graph of the solution on a number line looks like this:

----------(10)>>>>>>>>>>
